title: Watch the Tour de France Femmes with a free GCN+ pass from Lifeplus-Wahoo
content:
Cyclist
Watch the Tour de France Femmes with a free GCN+ pass from Lifeplus-Wahoo

British Continental Team Lifeplus-Wahoo is offering 10,000 GCN+ passes so that cycling fans in the UK can watch the Tour de France Femmes for free, both live and on demand. The second edition of the race, which runs from the 23rd – 30th July, will depart from Clermont-Ferrand and finish with an individual time-trial in Pau.

The eight-stage race is typically only available to view with a paid subscription for those in the UK and the team aims to make watching the Tour de France Femmes more accessible and increase the exposure of women’s cycling.

Want a free pass? Head here and don’t hang about, it’s first come, first serve.

The free passes come courtesy of the team’s title sponsors, Wahoo and the wellness brand Lifeplus. British riders April Tacey and Natalie Grinczer will take to the start line for the Lifeplus-Wahoo team as fans can watch the peloton ride 956km through southern France and into the Pyrenees, scaling the likes of the iconic Col d’Aspin and Col du Tourmalet.

The team previously offered 10,000 free GCN+ passes for the first edition of the Tour de France Femmes in 2022. The race was won by Annemiek van Vleuten as then-Le Col-Wahoo rider Maike van der Duin finished 6th on the Stage 1 and 5th on both Stage 2 and Stage 5.

Lifeplus-Wahoo manager Tom Varney said: ‘We’re so excited to be bringing this campaign back again for the Tour de France Femmes in 2023 … We want viewers to join in on the action with us and enjoy every minute of the race – plus to inspire them to get out on their bikes.’

Lifeplus-Wahoo has also adopted the ‘Lifeplus Foundation’ as their leading charity, whose summer fundraising project is to raise money and provide clean water for Bishop Sulumeti Girls Secondary School in Western Kenya.
